response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Closest Pair\", \"description\": \"Given an array of integers, find the pair that has the smallest absolute difference. If there are multiple pairs with the same smallest difference, return any one of them.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef closest_pair(arr: list[int]) -> tuple[int]:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `arr` (list[int]): A list of integers.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns a tuple containing the pair of integers from the input array that has the smallest absolute difference. If there are multiple pairs with the same smallest difference, return any one of them.\\n\", \"code\": \"def closest_pair(arr: list[int]) -> tuple[int]:\\n    min_diff = float('inf')\\n    result = ()\\n    for i in range(len(arr) - 1):\\n        for j in range(i + 1, len(arr)):\\n            diff = abs(arr[i] - arr[j])\\n            if diff < min_diff:\\n                min_diff = diff\\n                result = (arr[i], arr[j])\\n    return result\", \"tests\": [\"assert closest_pair([1, 5, 15, 20]) == (5, 15)\", \"assert closest_pair([-1, 10, 3, 8, -8]) == (-8, 3)\", \"assert closest_pair([0, 0]) == (0, 0)\", \"assert closest_pair([100, 150]) == (100, 150)\"] }"
